warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Pressure testing the cylinder head will reveal cracks in ports or sleeve leakage which cannot be observed using dye penetrant. Pressure test the cylinder head as follows:

step2.para: Fasten Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate on gasket side of cylinder head. Secure plate using ten M14 and five M8 mounting bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 146. Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate

step2.para: Install Pressure Test Regulator/Gauge assembly to Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate .
Immerse cylinder head in water. Apply air pressure and adjust to 124-138 kPa (18-20 psi) and inspect for leaks at the following places:

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, replace cylinder head if leaking.

step1.para: With the valves removed from the cylinder head, clean all valve guides using a nylon brush, soap and water. Blow out any residue with filtered compressed air. See .
Position an inspection light at the bottom of the valve guide bores and examine the walls for burning or cracking. Replace the head as necessary.

figure.caption: Figure 147. Measurement of small hole gauge (valve guide ID)

step1.para: Measure each valve guide by using a small hole gauge and a 0-1 inch outside micrometer. Record each valve guide inner diameter so valve-to-guide running clearance may be determined. If valve guide inner diameter exceeds specifications , replace cylinder head.
Using the valve guide inside diameter and the valve stem diameter measurements recorded earlier, determine valve stem-to-guide running clearance. See Specifications . Replace valve as required.
Clean valve seat area using suitable solvent, before inspection.
Inspect the exhaust valve seats for burned or cracked conditions. If any of these conditions exist, replace cylinder head.
